On Mon, 27 Jan 2003, Matthew Cooke wrote:

> There are other problems related to MockObject usage such as the singleton
> pattern. However there *are* workarounds to all problems and I have seen no
> situation where a test can not be written using MockObjects.

I wasn't quite clear on the question, really. If the question is, "Are
there situations where you cannot use a mock object to test without
making changes to the code you want to test," the answer is, of course,
"Yes." However, if making changes to the code under test to make it more
testable is allowed, well, anything's possible, given a little extra
time and possibly a large amount of ingenuity.

cjs
